Accountability, Social Impact, Privacy and Security, Transparency, Equity and Inclusion, Collaboration, Inclusivity and Accessibility, Equity and Accessibility

Safety and Security, If an AI system causes harm, it should be possible to ascertain why., Accountability, There should be constructive and healthy exchange between AI researchers and policy-makers., Justice, Teams developing AI systems should actively cooperate to avoid corner-cutting on safety standards., There being no consensus, we should avoid strong assumptions regarding upper limits on future AI capabilities., Non-maleficence, Beneficence, The economic prosperity created by AI should be shared broadly, to benefit all of humanity., Transparency, Explainability, and Accountability, Humans should choose how and whether to delegate decisions to AI systems, to accomplish human-chosen objectives., Superintelligence should only be developed in the service of widely shared ethical ideals, and for the benefit of all humanity rather than one state or organization., The power conferred by control of highly advanced AI systems should respect and improve, rather than subvert, the social and civic processes on which the health of society depends.
